summary: This bill, the "Improving Law Enforcement Officer Safety and Wellness Through Data Act of 2025," mandates the Attorney General to submit reports to Congress addressing violence against law enforcement officers, including ambushes and aggressive actions. The reports will analyze data on attacks, training programs, mental health resources for officers, and the effectiveness of protective gear distribution. The bill also seeks to identify legislative tools to improve officer safety and well-being, while consulting with stakeholders across all levels of law enforcement.
